headline.main: Childless, With Regret and Advice: Don't Wait for the Perfect Picture

docs.abstract: I didn’t want to become my mother, so I actively avoided becoming a mother at all until it was too late.
docs.snippet: I didn’t want to become my mother, so I actively avoided becoming a mother at all until it was too late.

headline.main: The Ever-Growing List of Obama Veto Threats

docs.lead_paragraph: After a revolt by Republican women on an abortion ban, the House instead passed a bill limiting the use of taxpayer funds to pay for abortions.

headline.main: Objections by Women Open Rift in G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: Objections by Women Open Rift in G.O.P.

docs.abstract: House Republicans relent on contentious bill to outlaw most abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy; decision, aimed at mending rift with outraged women voters, follows revolt in which several Republican congresswomen expressed dissent over provisions in legislation; move comes as thousands of abortion opponents held demonstration marking anniversary of Roe V Wade decision.
docs.snippet: After a revolt by Republican women on an abortion ban, the House instead passed a bill limiting the use of taxpayer funds to pay for abortions.

docs.lead_paragraph: Human rights activists on Thursday hailed a decision by El Salvador's congress to pardon a young woman who was convicted of killing her child after she said she suffered a miscarriage.

headline.main: Activists Hail Pardon for Salvador Woman in Miscarriage Case
headline.print_headline: Activists Hail Pardon for Salvador Woman in Miscarriage Case

docs.snippet: Human rights activists on Thursday hailed a decision by El Salvador's congress to pardon a young woman who was convicted of killing her child after she said she suffered a miscarriage.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. House of Representatives passed a bill permanently barring federal funding of abortions on Thursday after Republican leaders dropped harsher anti-abortion legislation due to opposition from some of the party's moderate lawmakers.

headline.main: Abortion Debate Roils U.S. House on Roe v. Wade Anniversary
headline.print_headline: Abortion Debate Roils U.S. House on Roe v. Wade Anniversary

docs.snippet: The U.S. House of Representatives passed a bill permanently barring federal funding of abortions on Thursday after Republican leaders dropped harsher anti-abortion legislation due to opposition from some of the party's moderate lawmakers.

docs.lead_paragraph: With thousands of abortion protesters swarming the city in their annual March for Life, Republicans muscled broadened abortion restrictions through the House on Thursday after a GOP rebellion forced leaders into an awkward retreat on an earlier version.

headline.main: GOP Pushes Abortion Bill Through House on March for Life Day
headline.print_headline: GOP Pushes Abortion Bill Through House on March for Life Day

docs.lead_paragraph: The average American has been stuck since the Reagan era in a predawn darkness of stagnation and inequality.
docs.abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column analyzes some points Pres Obama made in his State of the Union message; points out average American has not fared significantly better since Reagan era and that inequality has worsened further under Obama; favors some if his proposals, such as those that improve country's stalled education system and increase incentives to work.
docs.snippet: The average American has been stuck since the Reagan era in a predawn darkness of stagnation and inequality.
